description: Point 2: They don't feel so because of the "canonisation" of the classical corpus Where I argue that classical texts are quite well preserved after all (due to "canonisation", in a double-entendre sense that I explain), and that classicists don't feel they need digital scholarly editions because they consider textual variance not too meaningful and they are more focussed on the "Text" than on "documents". Point 3. The missing link: is there also a modelling flaw?
